quotes.quote: Ugrashravas, the son of Lomaharshana, humbly approaches the sages in Naimisha forest, bowing with folded hands.

quotes.quote: He describes the noble warriors who gathered there - the Pandavas, Kauravas, and kings of the earth - their armor gleaming in the sunlight before battle.

quotes.quote: The sages listen intently as the narrator explains how Vyasa composed this sacred history, blending Vedic wisdom with profound storytelling.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A silver-bearded man with wise eyes and a serene smile sits cross-legged, his hands forming mudras as he speaks. Around him, white-robed figures with attentive expressions lean forward. A faint golden aura surrounds them as sacred smoke curls from a small fire.

quotes.quote: The sacred text is revealed - a composition so profound it removes fear of sin, containing the essence of all four Vedas within its verses.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: An ancient palm-leaf manuscript lies open, its pages glowing with golden light. Delicate hands with henna patterns carefully turn a leaf, revealing intricate Sanskrit characters. The background fades into a starry night sky, suggesting cosmic wisdom.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: Sacred revelation. Based on lines 40-80 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: संहितां श्रोतुमिच्छामो धर्म्यां पापभयापहाम्

quotes.quote: In the beginning, there was only darkness. Then emerged a single cosmic egg, glowing with divine light, containing the seed of all creation.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: An endless void of deep indigo, swirling with faint silver mist. At center floats a colossal golden egg, its surface cracked with radiant light pouring through. Tiny star-like sparks dance around it in the cosmic darkness.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: cosmic origin. Based on lines 80-120 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: निष्प्रभेऽस्मिन्निरालोके...बृहदण्डमभूदेकं

quotes.quote: From the egg arose Brahma, the four-faced creator, whose breath became the Vedas. His golden aura illuminates the newly formed waters of existence.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A radiant figure with four serene faces emerges from the cracked egg, each face a different age. His long white beard flows like water as he exhales glowing Sanskrit letters. Below him, shimmering blue waters stretch infinitely.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: divine emergence. Based on lines 80-120 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यस्मात्पितामहो जज्ञे...ब्रह्मा सुरगुरुः

quotes.quote: The Prajapatis manifest - twenty-one primordial lords of creation. Their combined energy forms a mandala of cosmic order above the waters.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: Twenty-one luminous figures in flowing saffron robes float in concentric circles. Their outstretched hands emit golden threads that weave into an intricate mandala. The pattern pulses with energy above calm cosmic waters.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: manifestation of creators. Based on lines 80-120 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: प्राचेतसस्तथा दक्षो...प्राभवन्नेकविंशतिः

quotes.quote: From this divine order emerge all beings - gods, sages, and creatures visible and invisible. The universe breathes its first breath.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A cosmic tree grows from the waters, its branches splitting into countless realms. Ethereal figures of deities, sages with glowing eyes, and mystical creatures materialize among its leaves. A warm golden wind carries petals through the scene.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: birth of all existence. Based on lines 80-120 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: विश्वेदेवास्तथादित्या...ब्रह्मर्षयोऽमलाः

quotes.quote: The cosmic wheel turns endlessly, as the thirty-three thousand deities watch over creation and dissolution. Elements of nature—water, sky, earth, and wind—cycle in harmony.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A massive golden wheel floats in a cosmic expanse, its spokes radiating light. Thirty-three luminous figures with serene expressions, draped in flowing saffron robes, observe from above. Below, swirling elements—blue waters, golden winds, green earth—merge and separate in an eternal dance. Soft amber light bathes the scene.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: cosmic cycle. Based on lines 120-160 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: राजर्षयश्च बहवः... संवत्सरर्तवो मासाः

quotes.quote: The radiant sun god Surya, with his golden aura, watches as his descendants multiply—each generation brighter than the last, filling the world with light and wisdom.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A majestic figure with sunlit bronze skin and flaming hair stands atop a golden chariot, his arms outstretched. Below him, countless glowing figures—each with a unique radiance—emerge like stars. Warm winds carry petals through the air as the sky transitions from dawn to midday hues.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: divine lineage. Based on lines 120-160 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: दिवस्पुत्रो बृहद्भानुः... सहस्रज्योतिरात्मवान्

quotes.quote: From these luminous ancestors arise the great dynasties—the Kurus, the Yadavas, and the Ikshvakus—each branching like rivers from a single sacred source.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A towering cosmic tree with silver bark and golden leaves stands at the center. Three mighty rivers—one crimson, one sapphire, one emerald—flow from its roots, each carrying figures of noble bearing: warriors in ornate armor, wise elders with silver-streaked hair, and youths with determined gazes. Sunlight dapples through the leaves.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: dynastic origins. Based on lines 120-160 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: तेभ्योऽयं कुरुवंशश्च... राजर्षीणां च सर्वशः

quotes.quote: The secrets of existence—dharma, artha, kama—are woven into the fabric of the world, as timeless as the Vedas and as vast as the cosmos itself.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: An ancient scroll unfurls across the sky, its surface alive with shimmering symbols. The landscape glows with the soft light of dusk, fireflies dancing at the edges.

quotes.quote: Vyasa, the wise sage with deep-set eyes and matted hair, compiles the sacred knowledge of Dharma, Artha, and Kama into the great epic, surrounded by glowing manuscripts.

quotes.quote: The sage Vyasa compiles the great epic of 24,000 verses, the Mahabharata, while his disciples listen intently under ancient banyan trees.

quotes.quote: Sage Shuka teaches the epic to celestial beings - Narada to gods, Asita to ancestors, while Gandharvas and Yakshas gather to hear wisdom.

quotes.quote: The Kuru family tree revealed: Duryodhana as a poisonous tree with Karna and Shakuni as branches, while Yudhishthira's virtue grows with Arjuna and Bhima.

quotes.quote: The Pandavas return to Hastinapura - noble youths raised in sacred forests now presented to the court, sparking both joy and tension among the Kauravas.

quotes.quote: The Pandavas study sacred texts under wise teachers. Yudhishthira's wisdom, Bhima's strength, and Arjuna's skill with the bow earn them great respect among the people.

quotes.quote: After defeating powerful kings including Jarasandha, the Pandavas perform the grand Rajasuya sacrifice, establishing Yudhishthira as emperor with Krishna's guidance.

quotes.quote: Duryodhana, consumed by envy, gazes upon the Pandavas' magnificent palace filled with gold, jewels, and treasures, his face darkening with resentment.

quotes.quote: Duryodhana stumbles in the illusionary palace, mocked by Bhima as Krishna watches. The humiliated prince's face twists in rage and shame.

quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: humiliation and anger. Based on lines 280-320 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यत्रावहसितश्चासीत्प्रस्कन्दन्निव सम्भ्रमात्...भीमेनानभिजातवत्

quotes.quote: Dhritarashtra, the blind king, listens with sorrow as his son Duryodhana complains bitterly about the Pandavas' prosperity.

quotes.quote: Dhritarashtra confides in Sanjaya, torn between love for his son and wisdom, as the court stands divided in the growing conflict.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The blind king grips the arm of a composed man with observant eyes, whispering urgently. In the background, armored figures argue heatedly near marble pillars. Golden sunset light streams through arched windows, casting long shadows.

quotes.quote: Duryodhana, his face twisted with envy, watches from the shadows as Yudhishthira performs the Rajasuya sacrifice, his golden crown gleaming in the firelight.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A broad-shouldered man with dark, curled hair and a jeweled headband glares from behind marble pillars, his fists clenched. In the foreground, a serene-faced man in white robes offers ghee into sacred flames. Sunset paints the temple courtyard in amber hues.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: envy and contrast. Based on lines 320-360 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: राजसूये श्रियं दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवस्य महौजसः

quotes.quote: Shakuni whispers to Duryodhana beneath a silk canopy, his long fingers gesturing toward dice while oil lamps cast dancing shadows across their conspiratorial faces.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A gaunt man with sharp features and silver-threaded shawl leans close to the broad-shouldered prince, rolling ivory dice between bony fingers. Their faces are half-lit by flickering lamp flames, revealing cunning and resentment in their eyes.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: conspiracy. Based on lines 320-360 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: गान्धारराजसहितश्छद्मद्यूतममन्त्रयत्

quotes.quote: Draupadi stands alone in the empty hall, her single white garment fluttering as she clutches her disheveled hair, the marble floor reflecting her despair like a silent witness.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A woman with luminous dark skin and tear-streaked cheeks stands barefoot, her draped white sari slipping. Moonlight streams through latticed windows, casting geometric shadows across the polished floor where scattered jewels glint.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: violation and sorrow. Based on lines 320-360 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं द्रौपदीमश्रुकण्ठीं सभां नीतां

quotes.quote: Arjuna kneels in the Himalayan snows before a radiant figure with matted locks, their glowing trident illuminating the pine trees as divine energy crackles in the thin air.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A muscular man with battle-worn hands presses his forehead to icy ground before a luminous being with three vertical eyes. Blue energy swirls around the deity's crescent moon crown as snowflakes hover motionless in the charged air.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: divine encounter. Based on lines 320-360 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषमर्जुनो देवदेवं किरातरूपं

quotes.quote: In a land forbidden to mortals, Bhima and the Pandavas stand awestruck before Kubera's divine presence, their faces lit by golden light filtering through ancient trees.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A broad-shouldered man with wild dark hair stands protectively before four others, all gazing upward in wonder. A radiant figure with emerald skin and jeweled ornaments floats above them, surrounded by glowing treasures. Sunlight streams through dense foliage, casting dappled shadows on the mossy ground.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: divine encounter. Based on lines 360-400 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं वैश्रवणेन सार्धं; समागतं भीममन्यांश्च पार्थान्

quotes.quote: Arjuna, his Gandiva bow glowing faintly, releases a gandharva prince from enchanted bonds as celestial musicians watch from floating chariots in the twilight sky.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A lithe archer with coiled dark hair lets loose a golden arrow that shatters shimmering chains. A pale-skinned figure with delicate wings rises from broken bonds, while ethereal beings with moon-shaped harps hover above. The last amber light of dusk paints wispy clouds pink and purple.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: heroic action. Based on lines 360-400 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं घोषयात्रागतानां; बन्धं गन्धर्वैर्मोक्षणं चार्जुनेन

quotes.quote: Yudhishthira kneels before a yaksha disguised as a crane, answering riddles with hands folded in reverence as dawn breaks over the silent lake.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A tall man with a calm face and worn saffron robes kneels by mist-covered waters. Before him stands a slender crane with knowing golden eyes that glow unnaturally. First morning light turns the lake surface to liquid gold, with lotus buds beginning to unfurl.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: test of wisdom. Based on lines 360-400 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं यक्षरूपेण धर्मं; समागतं धर्मराजेन सूत

quotes.quote: Krishna stands radiant between Arjuna and Bhima, his blue skin glowing as seven akshauhini armies mass in the distance beneath gathering storm clouds.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A dark blue-skinned figure raises both hands between two warriors - one muscular with wild hair, the other lean with a silver bow. Behind them, countless banners flutter as armored legions prepare for battle. Dark clouds swirl ominously above the dusty plain, pierced by occasional lightning.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: impending war. Based on lines 360-400 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं नरनारायणौ तौ; कृष्णार्जुनौ वदतो नारदस्य

quotes.quote: Bhishma, the mighty warrior, lies on a bed of arrows, his white beard stained with dust, as Arjuna stands before him with a sorrowful gaze.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A white-bearded man with weathered skin lies on a bed of arrows, his ochre garments torn and bloodied. A dark-haired man in ornate armor stands before him, his silver bow lowered, eyes filled with sorrow. Golden sunset light filters through the battlefield's dust, casting long shadows.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: emotional confrontation. Based on lines 400-440 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं शरतल्पे शयानं; वृद्धं वीरं सादितं चित्रपुङ्खैः

quotes.quote: Arjuna pierces the earth with his arrow, creating a spring to quench Bhishma's thirst, as the old warrior watches with quiet gratitude.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The dark-haired archer draws his silver bow, releasing an arrow that strikes the cracked earth. Water gushes forth as the white-bearded man watches, his hands folded in gratitude. Sunlight glistens on the newly formed spring, surrounded by broken weapons.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: compassionate act. Based on lines 400-440 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं शान्तनवे शयाने; पानीयार्थे चोदितेनार्जुनेन

quotes.quote: The Kauravas cheer cruelly as young Abhimanyu falls, surrounded by their gleaming weapons, his face still fierce in death.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A youthful warrior with wild dark hair lies fallen, his bright armor pierced by numerous arrows. Around him, armored figures raise their weapons in triumph, their faces twisted with cruel joy. The sky darkens as crows circle overhead.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: tragic loss. Based on lines 400-440 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाभिमन्युं परिवार्य बालं; सर्वे हत्वा हृष्टरूपा बभूवुः

quotes.quote: Arjuna's chariot charges forward, Gandiva bow blazing, as Krishna steers through the chaos, their faces set with grim determination.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A dark-skinned charioteer with serene eyes grips the reins as the armored archer beside him draws his glowing silver bow. Their chariot races through swirling dust, golden light breaking through storm clouds. Streaks of arrows fill the air around them.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: heroic resolve. Based on lines 400-440 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं वाहनेष्वाश्वसत्सु; रथोपस्थे तिष्ठता गाण्डिवेन

quotes.quote: Karna, with his golden armor gleaming, releases a divine weapon towards the Pandava forces, his face set in grim determination as the battlefield trembles.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A muscular warrior with golden armor and piercing eyes stands atop a chariot, releasing a radiant arrow that streaks across the battlefield. Dust swirls around him as soldiers shield their eyes from the blinding light. The sky is streaked with orange and gold, hinting at the chaos of war.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: Conflict. Based on lines 440-480 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं कर्णमासाद्य मुक्तं; वधाद्भीमं कुत्सयित्वा वचोभिः

quotes.quote: Drona, the revered teacher, falls in battle, his white beard stained with dust as Dhrishtadyumna stands over him, his sword raised high.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: An elderly warrior with a white beard and weathered face lies fallen, his ochre robes torn. A fierce warrior with dark, wild hair stands above him, gripping a bloodied sword. The battlefield is littered with broken weapons, and the wind carries ash through the air.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: Tragedy. Based on lines 440-480 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणमाचार्यमेकं; धृष्टद्युम्नेनाभ्यतिक्रम्य धर्मम्

quotes.quote: Ashwatthama, consumed by rage, unleashes the divine Narayana Astra, its terrifying power lighting up the sky as the Pandava forces scatter in fear.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A young warrior with wild, unkempt hair and fiery eyes raises his arms, summoning a swirling vortex of celestial energy. The sky darkens as the divine weapon crackles with power, casting eerie blue light over the terrified soldiers below.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: Destruction. Based on lines 440-480 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदा द्रोणे निहते द्रोणपुत्रो; नारायणं दिव्यमस्त्रं विकुर्वन्

quotes.quote: Duryodhana, exhausted and defeated, staggers towards a lake, his pride shattered as the weight of his choices bears down upon him.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A broad-shouldered warrior with a wounded body and a broken mace limps towards a tranquil lake, his face etched with pain and regret. The water reflects the golden hues of sunset, contrasting with the darkness in his eyes.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: Defeat. Based on lines 440-480 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: यदाश्रौषं श्रान्तमेकं शयानं; ह्रदं गत्वा स्तम्भयित्वा तदम्भः

quotes.quote: Dhritarashtra, his blind eyes filled with tears, clutches his throne as Sanjaya recounts the horrors of war. The king's face is twisted in grief, unable to bear the news.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: An elderly man with sightless milky eyes and a long white beard sits slumped on an ornate wooden throne, his wrinkled hands gripping the armrests tightly. A middle-aged man with a solemn expression and simple robes stands before him, speaking softly. The palace hall is dimly lit by oil lamps casting long shadows.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: emotional reaction. Based on lines 480-520 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: 158-159

quotes.quote: Overcome by sorrow, Dhritarashtra collapses onto the marble floor. His royal garments spread around him like a fallen banner as attendants rush to his side.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The elderly king lies motionless on polished stone tiles, his ornate golden crown askew. Two younger figures in simple tunics kneel beside him, their faces showing concern. Sunlight streams through arched windows, illuminating dust motes in the air.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: physical collapse. Based on lines 480-520 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: 160

quotes.quote: Sanjaya, his wise eyes filled with compassion, helps the distraught king sit up. He begins to speak words of wisdom to comfort the grieving monarch.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The middle-aged man with short dark hair and a lined face gently supports the king's shoulders. The elderly ruler's face shows deep sorrow as he listens. Their figures are framed by billowing silk curtains that catch the golden afternoon light.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: comforting wisdom. Based on lines 480-520 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: 162

quotes.quote: Sanjaya reminds Dhritarashtra of Vyasa and Narada's teachings. The king's expression softens slightly as these ancient words begin to bring solace.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The two men sit facing each other on cushions, their hands gesturing in conversation. The king's posture is less rigid now, his blind eyes turned upward as if seeing beyond. The warm glow of sunset fills the chamber through latticed windows.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: spiritual consolation. Based on lines 480-520 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: 163

quotes.quote: Great warriors of old stand tall, their divine weapons gleaming with splendor equal to Indra himself, as they prepare for battle under the golden sun.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A group of muscular figures with ornate armor and radiant weapons stand in formation. Their faces show determination, with sunlight reflecting off their golden adornments. The background shows a vast battlefield under a clear blue sky with gentle clouds.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: character introduction. Based on lines 520-560 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: जातान्दिव्यास्त्रविदुषः शक्रप्रतिमतेजसः ॥१६४॥

quotes.quote: Through righteous deeds and grand sacrifices, these mighty rulers conquered lands and earned eternal fame, their names sung across the earth.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A regal figure with a golden crown and flowing robes performs a fire ritual, surrounded by priests. The smoke rises into the sky, forming shapes of blessings. The scene is bathed in warm sunset hues with intricate temple carvings in the background.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: ritual and conquest. Based on lines 520-560 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: धर्मेण पृथिवीं जित्वा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वाप्तदक्षिणैः

quotes.quote: Yet even these great souls could not escape time's embrace, as one by they fell like autumn leaves, returning to the earth from whence they came.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: An elderly warrior with silver hair and weathered face sits beneath a massive banyan tree, his once-shining armor now resting beside him. Falling leaves swirl around him in the golden light as he gazes peacefully at the horizon.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: passage of time. Based on lines 520-560 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: अस्मिँल्लोके यशः प्राप्य ततः कालवशं गताः ॥१६५॥

quotes.quote: Narada recounts the lineage of kings - Suhotra, Rantideva, Kakshivanta and others - whose deeds still echo through the ages like distant thunder.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A man with long dark hair and serene eyes gestures gracefully while speaking, his simple ochre robes fluttering in the breeze. Behind him, ghostly images of ancient kings appear like shadows in the golden light, their forms noble yet fading.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: storytelling and legacy. Based on lines 520-560 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: सुहोत्रं रन्तिदेवं च कक्षीवन्तं तथौशिजम् ॥१६६॥

quotes.quote: The wise man speaks of kings who abandoned great riches and power, meeting their fate through the actions of others. Their divine deeds and virtues are still sung by poets.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A man with long dark hair and serene eyes gestures toward ghostly figures of regal warriors in ornate armor, their forms translucent against a golden sunset. Falling leaves swirl around them as the wind carries petals through the air.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: remembrance of fallen kings. Based on lines 560-600 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: अविक्षित्प्रबलो धूर्तः...सत्यता शौचमार्जवम्

quotes.quote: He reminds that even those endowed with all virtues met their end, and that grieving for the wicked is unwise. The wise understand the nature of time and destiny.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The same dark-haired man points upward where the ghostly kings dissolve into swirling golden light. His face shows quiet wisdom as an elderly silver-haired warrior listens intently, hands folded in contemplation.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: wisdom about grief. Based on lines 560-600 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: विद्वद्भिः कथ्यते...न ताञ्शोचितुमर्हसि

quotes.quote: Time is the root of all things - it ripens all beings, destroys all creatures, then pacifies again. Time transforms all conditions in this world.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A cosmic vision appears between them - an enormous hourglass with sand flowing between realms. The upper chamber shows vibrant kingdoms, the lower shows ruins reclaimed by nature. The wind carries blossoms through the scene.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: concept of time. Based on lines 560-600 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: कालमूलमिदं...कालः संहरति प्रजाः

quotes.quote: Time moves equally through all beings, undisturbed. What was, what will be, and what is - all are governed by time's eternal flow.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The two men sit peacefully beneath the ancient tree as the vision fades. Golden light filters through leaves, illuminating dust motes. The elderly warrior's face shows acceptance, his hands resting on his lap as a single leaf lands in his palm.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: acceptance of time's nature. Based on lines 560-600 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: कालो विकुरुते...ये च वर्तन्ति साम्प्रतम्
